<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/phrase-of-the-year-vaccine-mandate?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Phrase of the Year: 'Vaccine Mandate'
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/phrase-of-the-year-vaccine-mandate?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Golden Mug award winner for phrase of the year " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/47f86b9239c92ec5a7e6b1af34c2c9264937d596-1920x1080.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Should you have to be fully vaccinated to enter your office? Eat at a restaurant? See Pearl Jam in concert? This year, those questions were more polarizing than cilantro.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Countries around the world have grappled with how exactly to compel their vaccine-hesitant populations to get shots, particularly as new and more contagious variants like Delta and Omicron have popped up. Few have gone as far as Austria, which earlier this month said it’s <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/b55d7b24-cc0b-456b-aa02-c13498be8234?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">requiring vaccines</a> for <em>everyone</em> over the age of 14.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the US, most vaccination mandates have been implemented by state and local governments, or by large companies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Blue chip firms like Goldman Sachs, Google, Delta Air Lines, Microsoft, Citigroup, and Tyson Foods </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/here-are-companies-mandating-vaccines-all-or-some-employees-n1275808?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a></span><span> some version of a vaccine mandate over the course of the year. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In all, two-thirds of US companies are planning to </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/26a606ee-9a2b-4129-8504-a4026c7c5dfd?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">require</a></span><span> at least some of their workers be vaccinated, according to a December survey of more than 6,000 employers.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But many individuals and GOP lawmakers have bristled at vaccine mandates, arguing that they’re a form of government overreach. Some of the most high-profile holdouts are elite athletes. Unvaccinated Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving hasn’t played a single game all season, and Packers QB Aaron Rodgers nearly broke the internet when he revealed he wasn’t vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the year progressed, momentum for vaccine mandates in the US <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/companies-suspend-vaccine-mandates-hospitals-amtrak-rcna8903?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lost some juice</a>. Major hospital systems, including HCA Healthcare and the Cleveland Clinic, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/some-hospitals-drop-covid-19-vaccine-mandates-to-ease-labor-shortages-11639396806?mod=hp_lead_pos2" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paused</a> their mandates as they struggled with a shortage of workers. GE, Amtrak, Boeing, and others also dropped their vaccine requirements since President Biden’s vax-or-test mandate for large employers got held up in the courts. (As of now, that mandate will be implemented in the new year after an appeals court allowed it to proceed.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>because two doses of vaccines appear to be less effective against the Omicron variant, we should expect more vaccine mandates to include <a href="https://www.axios.com/americans-split-on-what-it-means-to-be-fully-vaccinated-543a12fe-41ce-4321-bcae-309606e3f5ff.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">booster shots</a>. The NFL is requiring coaches and some staff to get a booster shot as of today, and some universities and arts organizations are also mandating boosters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">-----</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: “Transitory Inflation.”</strong> Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s once-favorite way to describe the current inflationary episode has been scrapped after higher prices spread across the economy and persisted longer than policymakers originally expected. The Fed has penciled in three rate hikes for next year in order to curb the highest inflation rate in 39 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: “Great Resignation.”</strong> Pity HR departments. As employees reconsidered their relationship with work—and what they demanded of employers—a record <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/12/a-record-4point4-million-people-quit-jobs-in-september-great-resignation.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">4.4 million people</a> (or 3% of the workforce) quit their jobs in September alone. And many more could be updating their LinkedIn profiles next year, too: A recent <a href="https://rh-us.mediaroom.com/2021-12-15-4-IN-10-WORKERS-PLAN-TO-LOOK-FOR-A-NEW-JOB-IN-FIRST-HALF-OF-2022?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">survey</a> showed that more than 40% of professionals are considering leaving their jobs in the first half of 2022.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/best-comeback-story-air-travel?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Best Comeback Story: Air Travel
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/best-comeback-story-air-travel?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt="Best comeback story: Air travel" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/3b0d55e2a0d94894f066bb330104025cdddf6cab-1920x1080.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Dianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In April 2020, the aviation industry went into sleep mode. US airlines carried just 2.9 million passengers that month, a 96.3% drop from the year before. Empty planes sat parked on the tarmac, and tumbleweeds drifted through airports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In all, US domestic air travel <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/ginaheeb/2021/02/16/us-air-travel-dropped-60-in-2020-as-covid-19-hammered-airlines/?sh=2a474f7b6978" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell by 59%</a> in 2020, while international travel fell 70%. The six biggest US airlines lost a collective $35 billion and shed 57,900 jobs from 2019.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What a difference a year makes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Wednesday before Thanksgiving 2021, about <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/25/world/thanksgiving-air-travel.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2.3 million people</a> passed through TSA checkpoints, or 88% of the total from the same day in 2019. Other signs point to a continued rebound in 2022…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>American Airlines plans to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/14/american-airlines-plans-to-hire-18000-people-next-year-for-travel-rebound.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hire</a></span><span> an additional 18,000 employees next year to keep up with demand, on top of the 16,000 new workers it hired this year.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Delta Air Lines is nearly doubling its transatlantic flight schedule for next summer in anticipation of more Euro trips by Americans looking for less ice in their drinks.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How’d it happen? </strong>With the rollout of vaccines, people became more comfortable flying again—for bachelorette parties, work conferences, and more. Plus, airlines were able to stay afloat during the roughest months thanks to a firehose of government aid. The US plugged airlines with $54 billion over the course of the pandemic to help cover payroll costs.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Aviation is not out of the woods yet</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s not yet clear to what extent the recent Omicron spike will dent leisure air travel, if at all. We <em>do</em> know that the new variant is hitting airlines’ major profit center: business travel. A few weeks ago, JPMorgan decided to <a href="https://www.statnews.com/2021/12/15/bowing-to-pressure-j-p-morgan-says-its-health-care-conference-will-be-virtual/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">move</a> its big health care conference online, highlighting how quickly corporations will pivot to virtual communications in the face of Covid spikes, leaving airlines in the lurch.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Another challenge for airlines is figuring out how to deal with an alarming rise in people who forgot their manners. The FAA has recorded more than <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-21/unruly-u-s-passengers-may-lose-tsa-precheck-privileges?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">5,600 cases</a> of unruly passengers since January 1 and launched 1,030 investigations (the previous record was 310 investigations in 2004).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because of the spike in obnoxious passengers, American Airlines won’t serve alcohol in the main cabin on domestic flights until Jan. 18 at the earliest. Southwest also won’t be serving alcohol until at least Jan. 2022.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">-----</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: New York City. </strong>In August 2020, hedge fund manager James Altucher infamously penned a <a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/nyc-dead-forever-heres-why-james-altucher/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">LinkedIn post</a> with the title, “NYC IS DEAD FOREVER.” He was…not correct. NYC was back to its buzzing self in 2021 thanks to the return of Broadway, sports, tourism, shopping, and work meetings. In the last year, NYC rents have <a href="https://therealdeal.com/2021/12/15/as-rent-explodes-nationally-new-york-city-tops-the-charts/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surged 32%</a>, topping SF as the most expensive city in the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner up: The job market. </strong>The US unemployment rate hit 4.2% in November, a remarkable drop from the 14.8% peak reached in April 2020. Some analysts say this is the best market for job seekers ever: There are more than <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/giant-gap-persists-between-job-openings-and-available-workers-11638959405?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">11 million job openings</a> in the US, compared to only 6.9 million people who are unemployed and looking for work.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
S
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/best-internet-moment-bernies-mittens?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}">
<font color="#000000">
Best Internet Moment: Bernie’s Mittens
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/best-internet-moment-bernies-mittens?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="">
<img alt='"Best Internet Moment" award with Bernie at Inauguration wearing mittens' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/76da094adf2a616d71ce46b18bad47a1255818a2-1920x1080.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em><em>Dianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images</em></em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After Washington, DC, endured a rough start to the year, President Joe Biden’s inauguration on January 20 was a calmer day of fashion, memes, and fashion memes: We’ll never forget Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders seated on the Capitol steps wearing 2021’s most iconic knitwear.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">It’s giving...nothing.</strong> The unimpressed Sanders <a href="https://twitter.com/AshleyKSmalls/status/1351929436128620547?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">memes</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/PigsAndPlans/status/1351957880958758912?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flooded</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/GuyFieri/status/1352319386007330817?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Twitter</a> for days and led to Snapchat filters, merch that raised $1.8 million for charity, and a big boost for Jen Ellis, the second-grade teacher who made the patterned mittens.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Ellis </span><span><a href="https://www.teenvogue.com/story/bernie-sanders-viral-mittens-teacher-interview?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a></span><span> Teen Vogue last winter that hours after the photo went viral, she received 5,000 emails from people who wanted to buy their own pair.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> While Bernie’s mittens may have stolen the show, the Biden admin didn’t waste any time signing executive orders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Within his first 24 hours in office, Biden enacted a mask mandate for all people in federal buildings and on federal land; he extended the federal eviction moratorium; he halted Trump’s border wall construction; he ended the travel ban on Muslim-majority countries; and he rejoined the Paris Agreement.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">-----</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner Up: The reappearance of Steve from <em>Blue’s Clues</em></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just when we needed him most, former <em>Blue’s Clues </em>star Steve <a href="https://twitter.com/nickjr/status/1435332689532440579?s=20" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">popped</a> up on Nick Jr.’s Twitter account in September and made us feel again. Steve’s sweet message marked the 25th anniversary of the first time we scream-sang, “We just got a letter!” at our TV sets.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Runner Up: Everything involving <em>Squid Game</em></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Netflix's most popular show ever didn’t just cement South Korea as an entertainment powerhouse, it spawned a cultural moment that lasted for months:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Halloween costumes inspired by the show were so popular that sales of white slip-on Vans shot up 7,800% in the month after it premiered.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><em>Squid Game</em></span><span>-themed crypto </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/the-squid-game-cryptocurrency-scam?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}&uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumped</a></span><span> 310,000% in less than two weeks (before being revealed as a scam.)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And YouTuber MrBeast spent $3.5 million building his own (nonviolent) </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0e3GPea1Tyg" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">version</a></span><span> of the games.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>—MM</em></p>
</div>

color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPhrase of the Year: 'Vaccine Mandate'\n\u003c/font\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/12/22/phrase-of-the-year-vaccine-mandate?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\u0026mid={{md5(profile.email)}}\u0026uid={{profile.vars.access_token}}\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Golden Mug award winner for phrase of the year \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/47f86b9239c92ec5a7e6b1af34c2c9264937d596-1920x1080.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShould you have to be fully vaccinated to enter your office? Eat at a restaurant? See Pearl Jam in concert? This year, those questions were more polarizing than cilantro.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCountries around the world have grappled with how exactly to compel their vaccine-hesitant populations to get shots, particularly as new and more contagious variants like Delta and Omicron have popped up. Few have gone as far as Austria, which earlier this month said it’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/b55d7b24-cc0b-456b-aa02-c13498be8234?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequiring vaccines\u003c/a\u003e for \u003cem\u003eeveryone\u003c/em\u003e over the age of 14.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the US, most vaccination mandates have been implemented by state and local governments, or by large companies. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBlue chip firms like Goldman Sachs, Google, Delta Air Lines, Microsoft, Citigroup, and Tyson Foods \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/here-are-companies-mandating-vaccines-all-or-some-employees-n1275808?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e some version of a vaccine mandate over the course of the year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn all, two-thirds of US companies are planning to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/26a606ee-9a2b-4129-8504-a4026c7c5dfd?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erequire\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e at least some of their workers be vaccinated, according to a December survey of more than 6,000 employers.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut many individuals and GOP lawmakers have bristled at vaccine mandates, arguing that they’re a form of government overreach. Some of the most high-profile holdouts are elite athletes. Unvaccinated Brooklyn Nets star Kyrie Irving hasn’t played a single game all season, and Packers QB Aaron Rodgers nearly broke the internet when he revealed he wasn’t vaccinated.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the year progressed, momentum for vaccine mandates in the US \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/companies-suspend-vaccine-mandates-hospitals-amtrak-rcna8903?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elost some juice\u003c/a\u003e. Major hospital systems, including HCA Healthcare and the Cleveland Clinic, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/some-hospitals-drop-covid-19-vaccine-mandates-to-ease-labor-shortages-11639396806?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaused\u003c/a\u003e their mandates as they struggled with a shortage of workers. GE, Amtrak, Boeing, and others also dropped their vaccine requirements since President Biden’s vax-or-test mandate for large employers got held up in the courts. (As of now, that mandate will be implemented in the new year after an appeals court allowed it to proceed.)\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ebecause two doses of vaccines appear to be less effective against the Omicron variant, we should expect more vaccine mandates to include \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/americans-split-on-what-it-means-to-be-fully-vaccinated-543a12fe-41ce-4321-bcae-309606e3f5ff.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebooster shots\u003c/a\u003e. The NFL is requiring coaches and some staff to get a booster shot as of today, and some universities and arts organizations are also mandating boosters.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e-----\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: “Transitory Inflation.”\u003c/strong\u003e Fed Chair Jerome Powell’s once-favorite way to describe the current inflationary episode has been scrapped after higher prices spread across the economy and persisted longer than policymakers originally expected. The Fed has penciled in three rate hikes for next year in order to curb the highest inflation rate in 39 years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: “Great Resignation.”\u003c/strong\u003e Pity HR departments. As employees reconsidered their relationship with work—and what they demanded of employers—a record \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/11/12/a-record-4point4-million-people-quit-jobs-in-september-great-resignation.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e4.4 million people\u003c/a\u003e (or 3% of the workforce) quit their jobs in September alone. And many more could be updating their LinkedIn profiles next year, too: A recent \u003ca href=\"https://rh-us.mediaroom.com/2021-12-15-4-IN-10-WORKERS-PLAN-TO-LOOK-FOR-A-NEW-JOB-IN-FIRST-HALF-OF-2022?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurvey\u003c/a\u003e showed that more than 40% of professionals are considering leaving their jobs in the first half of 2022.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDianna “Mick” McDougall; Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn April 2020, the aviation industry went into sleep mode. US airlines carried just 2.9 million passengers that month, a 96.3% drop from the year before. Empty planes sat parked on the tarmac, and tumbleweeds drifted through airports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn all, US domestic air travel \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/ginaheeb/2021/02/16/us-air-travel-dropped-60-in-2020-as-covid-19-hammered-airlines/?sh=2a474f7b6978\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell by 59%\u003c/a\u003e in 2020, while international travel fell 70%. The six biggest US airlines lost a collective $35 billion and shed 57,900 jobs from 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat a difference a year makes\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Wednesday before Thanksgiving 2021, about \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/25/world/thanksgiving-air-travel.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2.3 million people\u003c/a\u003e passed through TSA checkpoints, or 88% of the total from the same day in 2019. Other signs point to a continued rebound in 2022…\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAmerican Airlines plans to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/12/14/american-airlines-plans-to-hire-18000-people-next-year-for-travel-rebound.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehire\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e an additional 18,000 employees next year to keep up with demand, on top of the 16,000 new workers it hired this year.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDelta Air Lines is nearly doubling its transatlantic flight schedule for next summer in anticipation of more Euro trips by Americans looking for less ice in their drinks.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow’d it happen? \u003c/strong\u003eWith the rollout of vaccines, people became more comfortable flying again—for bachelorette parties, work conferences, and more. Plus, airlines were able to stay afloat during the roughest months thanks to a firehose of government aid. The US plugged airlines with $54 billion over the course of the pandemic to help cover payroll costs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAviation is not out of the woods yet\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s not yet clear to what extent the recent Omicron spike will dent leisure air travel, if at all. We \u003cem\u003edo\u003c/em\u003e know that the new variant is hitting airlines’ major profit center: business travel. A few weeks ago, JPMorgan decided to \u003ca href=\"https://www.statnews.com/2021/12/15/bowing-to-pressure-j-p-morgan-says-its-health-care-conference-will-be-virtual/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emove\u003c/a\u003e its big health care conference online, highlighting how quickly corporations will pivot to virtual communications in the face of Covid spikes, leaving airlines in the lurch.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnother challenge for airlines is figuring out how to deal with an alarming rise in people who forgot their manners. The FAA has recorded more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-12-21/unruly-u-s-passengers-may-lose-tsa-precheck-privileges?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e5,600 cases\u003c/a\u003e of unruly passengers since January 1 and launched 1,030 investigations (the previous record was 310 investigations in 2004).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause of the spike in obnoxious passengers, American Airlines won’t serve alcohol in the main cabin on domestic flights until Jan. 18 at the earliest. Southwest also won’t be serving alcohol until at least Jan. 2022.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e-----\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: New York City. \u003c/strong\u003eIn August 2020, hedge fund manager James Altucher infamously penned a \u003ca href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/nyc-dead-forever-heres-why-james-altucher/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLinkedIn post\u003c/a\u003e with the title, “NYC IS DEAD FOREVER.” He was…not correct. NYC was back to its buzzing self in 2021 thanks to the return of Broadway, sports, tourism, shopping, and work meetings. In the last year, NYC rents have \u003ca href=\"https://therealdeal.com/2021/12/15/as-rent-explodes-nationally-new-york-city-tops-the-charts/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurged 32%\u003c/a\u003e, topping SF as the most expensive city in the country.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRunner up: The job market. \u003c/strong\u003eThe US unemployment rate hit 4.2% in November, a remarkable drop from the 14.8% peak reached in April 2020. Some analysts say this is the best market for job seekers ever: There are more than \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/giant-gap-persists-between-job-openings-and-available-workers-11638959405?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e11 million job openings\u003c/a\u003e in the US, compared to only 6.9 million people who are unemployed
